summary: Joseph Timothy White is a PFC who reportedly defected to North Korea. The documents detail his background, including his ROTC enrollment, military police apprehension, enlistment in the US Army National Guard, and academic record. He attended Kemper Military School & College (KMSC), where he was known by Joseph C. Merlino. An agent report details an interview with Henry D. Glaister concerning White, focusing on White's background, associations, and political views during his time at KMSC. The documents also mention attempts to contact relevant personnel for further information about White. His father is also mentioned in the context of releasing a previous agent report.
significance: The significance of Joseph Timothy White in the JFK context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. However, the extensive investigation into his background and reported defection to North Korea suggests potential connections to broader national security concerns during the Cold War era, which may have some tangential relevance to the JFK assassination depending on further context not provided in these documents.
